about.title: ğŸ‘‹ About Me
description: I'm Joe Jigwan, a backend-oriented developer and a senior student majoring in Computer Engineering at Kyonggi University. I mainly focus on building web services and server-side applications with Java and Spring Boot.

Through capstone projects, research activities, and team projects, Iâ€™ve gained hands-on experience in designing REST APIs, implementing real-time notifications with MongoDB, and deploying services on AWS in environments close to production.
about.strength1: Experience in designing and deploying RESTful API servers with Spring Boot and AWS
about.strength2: Database-centric development including schema design, indexing, and transaction handling
about.strength3: Frontend and full-stack development with React + TypeScript SPA
about.strength4: Implemented an object detection model with YOLO + TACO dataset and developed a RAG-based car assistant backend, both of which led to award-winning projects

projects.title: ğŸ’¼ Featured Projects
projects.movie_diary: An AI emotion-based service that analyzes user diaries to classify emotions and recommends movies. Built with React and Flask.
projects.gildongE: A Spring Boot and MongoDB-based car assistant backend system. Handled real-time notifications, consumable replacement calculations, and API deployment.
projects.build_your_health: A React-based health routine management app. Allows users to log status data and manage goal-based routines.
projects.kakao_clone: A KakaoTalk UI clone project from the Nomad Coders Challenge. Selected as an outstanding work. Implemented responsive UI and message list interface using HTML/CSS/JS.
projects.dragonball: A price comparison web service for PC parts
projects.dynamic_scraper: Web crawling practice using BeautifulSoup + Playwright
projects.momentum: A clone of the Momentum app implementing weather, greeting, and to-do list
